com.panviva.util.pgc.rule

Class Rule

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.panviva.util.pgc.rule.Rule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IRule

    public class Rule
extends java.lang.Object
implements IRule
    This class models the fundamental components of a rule or transform.
    Author:
    jcharles

    • Method Detail

      • setType

        public void setType(IRuleType type)
        Set the rule type passing RuleType enumerated type values. Valid values are: PARTITION, CREATE, INSERT, REPLACE, MOVE, COPY, DELETE, NOT_SET
        Specified by:
        setType in interface IRule
        Parameters:
        type - IRuleType implementation instance

      • setType

        public void setType(java.lang.String type)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Set the rule type from a string value. If the values does not exist in the RuleType enumeration an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        type - - String
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if an invalid type param is used

      • setType

        public void setType(org.w3c.dom.Node xType)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Set the RuleType from rule element node attributes. This method is used by the RuleSetManager parser.
        Parameters:
        xType - - Node
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if an invalid node with a node name other than type is used

      • getType

        public IRuleType getType()
        Get the RuleType. Valid values are: PARTITION, CREATE, INSERT, REPLACE, MOVE, COPY, DELETE, NOT_SET
        Specified by:
        getType in interface IRule
        Returns:
        IRuleType - RuleType

      • getSubType

        public IRuleSubType getSubType()
        Get the Rule Sub Type. The RuleSubType is used to indicate addition types of rules within a specific rule. It is used to define custom or just extensions to transforms. Valid values are: MOVE_IMAGES, COPY_IMAGES, PROCESS_EMAILS, CONTENT, ADJACENT, NOT_SET;
        Specified by:
        getSubType in interface IRule
        Returns:
        IRuleSubType - RuleSubType

      • setSubType

        public void setSubType(IRuleSubType subType)
        Set the Rule Sub Type using RuleSubType enumerated values
        Specified by:
        setSubType in interface IRule
        Parameters:
        subType - IRuleSubType implementation instance - RuleSubType

      • setSubType

        public void setSubType(java.lang.String subType)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Set the Rule Sub Type using a string value. If the value does not exist in the RuleSubType enumerated list an exception will be thrown.
        Specified by:
        setSubType in interface IRule
        Parameters:
        subType - - String
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if an invalid rule sub type is used

      • setSubType

        Parameters:

        Throws:

      • setTarget

        public void setTarget(java.lang.String target)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Set the rule target using a string. If a value not used in RuleTarget enumerated list an exception will be thrown Valid values include: FOLDER, DOCUMENT, SECTION, TASK, ELEMENT, ELEMENT_VALUE, ATTRIBUTE_VALUE, NOT_SET
        Parameters:
        target - - String
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if an invalid rule target string is used

      • setTarget

        public void setTarget(org.w3c.dom.Node xTarget)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Set the rule target from the rule element attribute called target. If an invalid value is used an exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        xTarget - - Node
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if an invalid node rule target is used

      • getTargetType

        public IRuleTargetType getTargetType()
        Get the rule target type. Valid values include: PROCEDURE, POLICY, PROCESS, EXTERNAL, NOT_SET
        Specified by:
        getTargetType in interface IRule
        Returns:
        IRuleTarget Rule Target

      • setTargetType

        public void setTargetType(IRuleTargetType targetType)
        Set the rule target type. Valid values include: PROCEDURE, POLICY, PROCESS, EXTERNAL, NOT_SET
        Specified by:
        setTargetType in interface IRule
        Parameters:
        targetType - IRuleTargetType implementation instance - RuleTargetType

      • setTargetType

        public void setTargetType(java.lang.String targetType)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Set the rule target type from a string. If an invalid value is passed an exception is thrown. Valid values include: "procedure", "policy", "process", "external", "not_set"
        Specified by:
        setTargetType in interface IRule
        Parameters:
        targetType - Target Type string
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if an invalid target type is specified

      • setTargetType

        public void setTargetType(org.w3c.dom.Node xTargetType)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Set the target type from the rule element target_type attribute. This is used to set different types of documents. The default document type is procedure. This method is used by the RuleSetManager parser.
        Parameters:
        xTargetType - - Node
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if a node name other than target_type is used.

      • getTarget

        public IRuleTarget getTarget()
        Get the rule target. Valid values include: FOLDER, DOCUMENT, SECTION, TASK, ELEMENT, ELEMENT_VALUE, ATTRIBUTE_VALUE, NOT_SET Currently only FOLDER, DOCUMENT, SECTION, TASK values are used.
        Specified by:
        getTarget in interface IRule
        Returns:
        target - IRuleTarget implementation instance - RuleTarget

      • getDocumentRootXPath

        public java.lang.String getDocumentRootXPath()
        Get the document root XPATH. The generated XHtml documents have a top level div element with an attribute class="document". This method returns the XPATH to where that div is located in the intermediary XHtml document.
        Specified by:
        getDocumentRootXPath in interface IRule
        Returns:
        documentRootXPath Document root XPath string

      • setDocumentRootXPath

        Parameters:

      • setDisable

        public void setDisable(org.w3c.dom.Node xDisable)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Set the disable flag to enable or disable this rule from being executed using the rule element disable attribute. This method is used by the RuleSetManager.
        Parameters:
        xDisable - Rule disable attribute node
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if a node whose value other than true or false is used
